   pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.strings.Strings




.. py:class:: Strings


   High-performance string utilities for scientific computing.

   Provides conversion between numbers and strings, word wrapping, trimming, and case conversion.
   All methods use camelCase. Context-enabled for future extensibility.

   .. py:method:: int2str(i: int, n: Optional[int] = None) -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert integer to string, optionally with fixed width.

      :param i: Integer to convert.
      :type i: int
      :param n: Fixed width for output string.
      :type n: int, optional

      :returns: String representation of integer.
      :rtype: str


   .. py:method:: bool2str(x: bool, n: Optional[int] = None) -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert boolean to string ('T' or 'F'), optionally with fixed width.

      :param x: Boolean value.
      :type x: bool
      :param n: Fixed width for output string.
      :type n: int, optional

      :returns: String representation ('T' or 'F').
      :rtype: str


   .. py:method:: dbl2str(x: float, p: int = 5, e: int = 3, frmt: str = 'ES') -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert double to string using scientific format.

      :param x: Value to convert.
      :type x: float
      :param p: Precision.
      :type p: int
      :param e: Exponent length.
      :type e: int
      :param frmt: Format specifier ('ES', 'EN', 'E', 'D').
      :type frmt: str

      :returns: String representation.
      :rtype: str


   .. py:method:: sgl2str(x: float, p: int = 5, e: int = 3, frmt: str = 'ES') -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert single precision float to string using scientific format.


   .. py:method:: wordwrap(s: str, n: int = 80) -> List[str]
      :staticmethod:

      Wrap text to lines of maximum length n.

      :param s: Input string.
      :type s: str
      :param n: Maximum line length.
      :type n: int

      :returns: List of wrapped lines.
      :rtype: List[str]


   .. py:method:: trimb(x: str) -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Trim spaces off both ends of a string.


   .. py:method:: toupper(s: str) -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert string to upper case.


   .. py:method:: tolower(s: str) -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert string to lower case.


   .. py:method:: cmplx2str(z: complex, p: int = 5, e: int = 3) -> str
      :staticmethod:

      Convert complex number to string using dbl2str for real and imaginary parts.
